greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (phi(-x) / phi(-x^3))^2 in powers of x where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of eta(q)^4 * eta(q^6)^2 / (eta(q^2)^2 * eta(q^3)^4) in powers of q.
G.f. A(x) satisfies 0 = f(A(x), A(x^2)) where f(u, v) = (1 + u) * (u + v^2) - 4 * u.
G.f. A(x) satisfies 0 = f(A(x), A(x^3)) where f(u, v) = u * (3 + u * v)^2 - v * (3*u + v)^2.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (12 t)) = 3 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. of A217786.
Convolution inverse of A186924. Convolution square of A139137.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q]^2 / EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q^3]^2, {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Mar 24 2013 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^4 * eta(x^6 + A)^2 / (eta(x^2 + A)^2 * eta(x^3 + A)^4), n))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Mar 24 2013
